citation.article-title: Five new members of the Streptomyces violaceusniger 16S rRNA gene clade: Streptomyces castelarensis sp. nov., comb. nov., Streptomyces himastatinicus sp. nov., Streptomyces mordarskii sp. nov., Streptomyces rapamycinicus sp. nov. and Streptomyces ruanii sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Streptomyces himastatinicus sp. nov.

Streptomyces himastatinicus (hi.ma.sta.ti′ni.cus. N.L. neut. n. himastatinum; L. suffix icus-a-um related to; N.L. masc. adj. himastatinicus related to himastatin, referring to the ability to produce himastatin).
The description is based upon data taken from this and a previous study (Lam et al., 1990).
Rugose ornamented, oval to barrel-shaped spores (0.5–0.7×0.5–1.2 μm) are borne in spiral chains with two to eight turns.
Grows well on modified Bennett's, glycerol-asparagine, oatmeal and yeast extact-malt extract agars.
On oatmeal agar the aerial spore mass colour is grey, becoming black and moist when mature, and the substrate mycelium greyish-yellow; diffusible pigments are not formed.
Melanin pigments are not produced on either peptone-yeast extract-iron or tyrosine agars.
Growth occurs between 10 and 37 °C, but not at 4 or 40 °C, and at pH values from 5 to 10, but not at pH 4.0 or 11.0.
Degrades starch and Tween 40, but not cellulose, chitin, DNA, pectin, RNA, tributyrin, xanthine or xylan.

d-Fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-glycerol, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, soluble starch, sucrose, trehalose and d-xylose are used as sole sources of carbon for energy and growth, but not amygdalin, d-arabinose, cellobiose, dulcitol or d-sorbitol (all at 1 %, w/v).
Butan-1,4-diol is used as a sole carbon source, but not methanol or propanol (all at 1 %, v/v).

l-Arginine, l-asparagine, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-isoleucine, l-ornithine, l-proline and l-threonine are used as sole nitrogen sources for energy and growth, but not aminobutyric acid, dl-aspartic acid, l-leucine, dl-norleucine or l-norvaline (all at 1 %, w/v).
Grows in the presence of 8 % (w/v) NaCl, but not in the presence of 10 % (w/v) NaCl or 0.1 % (v/v) phenol.
Sensitive to gentamicin sulphate, kanamycin sulphate, neomycin sulphate, streptomycin sulphate and tobramycin sulphate (each at 8 μg ml−1). Additional phenotypic properties are shown in Table 1.
Whole-organism hydrolysates contain ll-diaminopimelic acid; major phospholipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, diphosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylinositol.
Produces the antibiotic himastatin that shows antimicrobial activity against Gram-positive bacteria.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 71.2 mol%.
The type strain, ATCC 53653T (=DSM 41914T), was isolated from soil collected from the State of Himachal Pradesh, India.
